title: Pelicot rape case returns to court for lone appellant's trial
subhead: One year after the marathon trial that resulted in the conviction of 51 men for rape, attempted rape or sexual assault against Gisèle Pelicot, an appeals court is set to review the actions of Husamettin Dogan, age 44. In the first trial, he was sentenced to nine years in prison.

title: Nobel Prize in medicine celebrates immune system research
subhead: Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell and Dr. Shimon Sakaguchi were awarded with the Nobel Prize in medicine on Monday for their discoveries about the way the body helps the immune system to stay on track.

title: Sébastien Lecornu led France's briefest government in over a century
subhead: The former defense minister spent just one-third as long in office as Michel Barnier in 2024. The last government that lasted so little was in 1924, under the Third Republic.

title: Three hours in Gaza City, an ocean of ruins emptied of its people
subhead: Le Monde's Jerusalem correspondent entered the Palestinian urban area for a few hours on Friday, October 3, under escort from the Israel Defense Forces (IDF). The territory, largely destroyed by airstrikes and bulldozers, was utterly deserted, with nearly all residents having fled south within the enclave.
byline: By Luc Bronner (Gaza City, special correspondent)

title: Returning to Spain after generations of exile
subhead: The country is experiencing a sharp rise in population, driven by a wave of 'grandchildren' settling in the land of their ancestors who fled Francoist Spain, a place to which they feel attached, despite never having lived there.
